Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: mamba
Description: Mamba is a reimplementation of the conda package manager in C++

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show help for mamba and exit

Arguments.Name: --version
Arguments.Description: Show the conda version number and exit

Arguments.Name: activate
Arguments.Description: Activate an environment

Arguments.Name: --stack
Arguments.Description: Stack the environment being activated on top of the previous active environment

Arguments.Name: --no-stack
Arguments.Description: Do not stack the environment. Overrides 'auto_stack' setting

Arguments.Name: environment
Arguments.Description: environment

Arguments.Name: deactivate
Arguments.Description: Deactivate an environment

Arguments.Name: clean
Arguments.Description: Remove unused packages and caches

Arguments.Name: -a
Arguments.Description: Remove index cache, lock files, unused cache packages, and tarballs

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Remove index cache

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Remove unused packages from writable package caches

Arguments.Name: -t
Arguments.Description: Remove cached package tarballs

Arguments.Name: -f
Arguments.Description: Remove all writable package caches

Arguments.Name: -l
Arguments.Description: Remove log files

Arguments.Name: --locks
Arguments.Description: Remove lock files

Arguments.Name: -c
Arguments.Description: Remove temporary files that could not be deleted earlier due to being in-use. Argument is path(s) to prefix(es) where files should be found and removed

Arguments.Name: file
Arguments.Description: file

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Only display what would have been done

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Report all output as json. Suitable for using conda programmatically

Arguments.Name: -q
Arguments.Description: Do not display progress bar

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Can be used multiple times. Once for INFO, twice for DEBUG, three times for TRACE

Arguments.Name: -y
Arguments.Description: Do not ask for confirmation

Arguments.Name: compare
Arguments.Description: Compare packages between conda environments

Arguments.Name: -n
Arguments.Description: Name of environment

Arguments.Name: environment
Arguments.Description: environment

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Full path to environment location (i.e. prefix)

Arguments.Name: path
Arguments.Description: path

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Show this help message and exit

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Report all output as json. Suitable for using conda programmatically

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Use once for info, twice for debug, three times for trace

Arguments.Name: -q
Arguments.Description: Do not display progress bar

Arguments.Name: file
Arguments.Description: file

Arguments.Name: create
Arguments.Description: Create a new conda environment from a list of specified packages

Arguments.Name: --clone
Arguments.Description: Path to (or name of) existing local environment

Arguments.Name: env
Arguments.Description: env

Arguments.Name: --file
Arguments.Description: Read package versions from the given file. Repeated file specifications can be passed (e.g. --file=file1 --file=file2)

Arguments.Name: file
Arguments.Description: file

Arguments.Name: --dev
Arguments.Description: Use sys.executable -m conda in wrapper scripts instead of CONDA_EXE. This is mainly for use during tests where we test new conda source against old Python versions

Arguments.Name: -n
Arguments.Description: Name of environment

Arguments.Name: environment
Arguments.Description: environment

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Full path to environment location (i.e. prefix)

Arguments.Name: path
Arguments.Description: path

Arguments.Name: -c
Arguments.Description: They are given (including local directories using the 'file://' syntax or simply a path like '/home/conda/mychan' or '../mychan'). Then, the defaults or channels from .condarc are searched (unless --override-channels is given). You can use 'defaults' to get the default packages for conda. You can also use any name and the .condarc channel_alias value will be prepended. The default channel_alias is http://conda.anaconda.org/

Arguments.Name: channel
Arguments.Description: channel

Arguments.Name: --use-local
Arguments.Description: Use locally built packages. Identical to '-c local'

Arguments.Name: --override-channels
Arguments.Description: Do not search default or .condarc channels. Requires --channel

Arguments.Name: --repodata-fn
Arguments.Description: Specify name of repodata on remote server. Conda will try whatever you specify, but will ultimately fall back to repodata.json if your specs are not satisfiable with what you specify here. This is used to employ repodata that is reduced in time scope. You may pass this flag more than once. Leftmost entries are tried first, and the fallback to repodata.json is added for you automatically

Arguments.Name: repodata
Arguments.Description: repodata

Arguments.Name: --strict-channel-priority
Arguments.Description: Packages in lower priority channels are not considered if a package with the same name appears in a higher priority channel

Arguments.Name: --no-channel-priority
Arguments.Description: Package version takes precedence over channel priority. Overrides the value given by conda config --show channel_priority

Arguments.Name: --no-deps
Arguments.Description: Do not install, update, remove, or change dependencies. This WILL lead to broken environments and inconsistent behavior. Use at your own risk

Arguments.Name: --only-deps
Arguments.Description: Only install dependencies

Arguments.Name: --no-pin
Arguments.Description: Ignore pinned file

Arguments.Name: --no-default-packages
Arguments.Description: Ignore create_default_packages in the .condarc file

Arguments.Name: --copy
Arguments.Description: Install all packages using copies instead of hard- or soft-linking

Arguments.Name: -C
Arguments.Description: Use cache of channel index files, even if it has expired

Arguments.Name: -k
Arguments.Description: Allow conda to perform insecure SSL connections and transfers. Equivalent to setting 'ssl_verify' to 'false'

Arguments.Name: --offline
Arguments.Description: Offline mode. Don't connect to the Internet

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Only display what would have been done

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Report all output as json. Suitable for using conda programmatically

Arguments.Name: -q
Arguments.Description: Do not display progress bar

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Can be used multiple times. Once for INFO, twice for DEBUG, three times for TRACE

Arguments.Name: -y
Arguments.Description: Do not ask for confirmation

Arguments.Name: --download-only
Arguments.Description: Solve an environment and ensure package caches are populated, but exit prior to unlinking and linking packages into the prefix

Arguments.Name: --show-channel-urls
Arguments.Description: Show channel urls. Overrides the value given by conda config --show show_channel_urls

Arguments.Name: package_spec
Arguments.Description: package_spec

Arguments.Name: info
Arguments.Description: Display information about current conda install

Arguments.Name: -a
Arguments.Description: Show all information

Arguments.Name: --base
Arguments.Description: Display base environment path

Arguments.Name: -e
Arguments.Description: List all known conda environments

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: List environment variables

Arguments.Name: --unsafe-channels
Arguments.Description: Display list of channels with tokens exposed

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Report all output as json. Suitable for using conda programmatically

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Use once for info, twice for debug, three times for trace

Arguments.Name: -q
Arguments.Description: Do not display progress bar

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Initialize conda for shell interaction. [Experimental]

Arguments.Name: install
Arguments.Description: Installs a list of packages into a specified conda environment

Arguments.Description: Revert to the specified REVISION

Arguments.Name: --strict-channel-priority
Arguments.Description: Packages in lower priority channels are not considered if a package with the same name appears in a higher priority channel

Arguments.Name: --no-channel-priority
Arguments.Description: Package version takes precedence over channel priority. Overrides the value given by conda config --show channel_priority

Arguments.Name: --no-deps
Arguments.Description: Do not install, update, remove, or change dependencies. This WILL lead to broken environments and inconsistent behavior. Use at your own risk

Arguments.Name: --only-deps
Arguments.Description: Only install dependencies

Arguments.Name: --no-pin
Arguments.Description: Ignore pinned file

Arguments.Name: --force-reinstall
Arguments.Description: Ensure that any user-requested package for the current operation is uninstalled and reinstalled, even if that package already exists in the environment

Arguments.Name: --freeze-installed
Arguments.Description: Do not update or change already-installed dependencies

Arguments.Name: --update-deps
Arguments.Description: Update dependencies

Arguments.Name: -S
Arguments.Description: Exit early and do not run the solver if the requested specs are satisfied. Also skips aggressive updates as configured by 'aggressive_update_packages'. Similar to the default behavior of 'pip install'

Arguments.Name: --update-all
Arguments.Description: Update all installed packages in the environment

Arguments.Name: --update-specs
Arguments.Description: Update based on provided specifications

Arguments.Name: --copy
Arguments.Description: Install all packages using copies instead of hard- or soft-linking

Arguments.Name: -m
Arguments.Description: Create the environment directory if necessary

Arguments.Name: --clobber
Arguments.Description: Allow clobbering of overlapping file paths within packages, and suppress related warnings

Arguments.Description: channel

Arguments.Name: --use-local
Arguments.Description: Use locally built packages. Identical to '-c local'

Arguments.Name: --override-channels
Arguments.Description: Do not search default or .condarc channels. Requires --channel

Arguments.Name: --repodata-fn
Arguments.Description: Specify name of repodata on remote server. Conda will try whatever you specify, but will ultimately fall back to repodata.json if your specs are not satisfiable with what you specify here. This is used to employ repodata that is reduced in time scope. You may pass this flag more than once. Leftmost entries are tried first, and the fallback to repodata.json is added for you automatically

Arguments.Name: repodata
Arguments.Description: repodata

Arguments.Name: --strict-channel-priority
Arguments.Description: Packages in lower priority channels are not considered if a package with the same name appears in a higher priority channel

Arguments.Name: --no-channel-priority
Arguments.Description: Package version takes precedence over channel priority. Overrides the value given by conda config --show channel_priority

Arguments.Name: --no-deps
Arguments.Description: Do not install, update, remove, or change dependencies. This WILL lead to broken environments and inconsistent behavior. Use at your own risk

Arguments.Name: --only-deps
Arguments.Description: Only install dependencies

Arguments.Name: --no-pin
Arguments.Description: Ignore pinned file

Arguments.Name: --force-reinstall
Arguments.Description: Ensure that any user-requested package for the current operation is uninstalled and reinstalled, even if that package already exists in the environment

Arguments.Name: --freeze-installed
Arguments.Description: Do not update or change already-installed dependencies

Arguments.Name: --update-deps
Arguments.Description: Update dependencies

Arguments.Name: -S
Arguments.Description: Exit early and do not run the solver if the requested specs are satisfied. Also skips aggressive updates as configured by 'aggressive_update_packages'. Similar to the default behavior of 'pip install'

Arguments.Name: --update-all
Arguments.Description: Update all installed packages in the environment

Arguments.Name: --update-specs
Arguments.Description: Update based on provided specifications

Arguments.Name: --copy
Arguments.Description: Install all packages using copies instead of hard- or soft-linking

Arguments.Name: --clobber
Arguments.Description: Allow clobbering of overlapping file paths within packages, and suppress related warnings

Arguments.Name: -C
Arguments.Description: Use cache of channel index files, even if it has expired

Arguments.Name: -k
Arguments.Description: Allow conda to perform insecure SSL connections and transfers. Equivalent to setting 'ssl_verify' to 'false'

Arguments.Name: --offline
Arguments.Description: Offline mode. Don't connect to the Internet

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Only display what would have been done

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Report all output as json. Suitable for using conda programmatically

Arguments.Name: -q
Arguments.Description: Do not display progress bar

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Can be used multiple times. Once for INFO, twice for DEBUG, three times for TRACE

Arguments.Name: -y
Arguments.Description: Do not ask for confirmation

Arguments.Name: --download-only
Arguments.Description: Solve an environment and ensure package caches are populated, but exit prior to unlinking and linking packages into the prefix

Arguments.Name: --show-channel-urls
Arguments.Description: Show channel urls. Overrides the value given by conda config --show show_channel_urls

Arguments.Name: package
Arguments.Description: package

Arguments.Name: mamba
Arguments.Description: Update mamba

Arguments.Name: repoquery
Arguments.Description: Query repositories using mamba

Arguments.Name: search
Arguments.Description: Search for packages and display associated information. The input is a MatchSpec, a query language for conda packages

Arguments.Name: -c
Arguments.Description: They are given (including local directories using the 'file://' syntax or simply a path like '/home/conda/mychan' or '../mychan'). Then, the defaults or channels from .condarc are searched (unless --override-channels is given). You can use 'defaults' to get the default packages for conda. You can also use any name and the .condarc channel_alias value will be prepended. The default channel_alias is http://conda.anaconda.org/

Arguments.Name: channel
Arguments.Description: channel

Arguments.Description: Use locally built packages. Identical to '-c local'

Arguments.Name: --override-channels

This is used to employ repodata that is reduced in time scope. You may pass this flag more than once. Leftmost entries are tried first, and the fallback to repodata.json is added for you automatically

Arguments.Name: -k
Arguments.Description: Allow conda to perform 'insecure SSL' connections and transfers. Equivalent to setting 'ssl_verify' to 'false'

Arguments.Description: Offline mode. Don't connect to the Internet

Arguments.Description: Search for xtensor version which is more than 0.18

Arguments.Description: List dependencies for a package
